summary: This is a Certificate of Authenticity of Business Records, signed by an IRS employee, declaring that attached records are authentic duplicates of originals kept in the regular course of business. It is a procedural document used to establish the admissibility of financial or business records in an investigation.

persons.name: MaMato Awl
persons.context: Declares under penalty of perjury that attached business records are authentic duplicates of originals kept in the regular course of business.

events.title: Signing of Certificate of Authenticity
events.description: An IRS employee signs a certificate declaring the authenticity of attached business records for use in an investigation.

keyFacts: The document is a Certificate of Authenticity of Business Records, used to establish the admissibility of records in legal proceedings.
It is signed under penalty of perjury by an IRS employee named MaMato Awl, who is a custodian of records.
The certificate attests that the attached records are exact duplicates of originals made and kept in the regular course of business.
The document is dated January 21, 2020, and is part of an investigation referenced by number 2015n00988.09S.
